notes: Around 9 February 2022, in the rural area of the Medio San Juan municipality (coded to Andagoya, Choco), ELN members killed an Wounaan indigenous leader after the community was unable to pay the armed group for his release. The victim was abducted by the armed men on 3 February (coded separately). There are no further details on the attack. 1 fatality.

Around 9 February 2022, in the rural area of Toribio municipality (Cauca), a man was killed and his body was found near the Chiviqui vereda. Witnesses claimed armed men killed the victim. Perpetrator left a pamphlet claiming this would happen to all people found 'stealing and consuming drugs'. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 8 February 2022, in the rural area of San Lorenzo corregimiento (Cauca), a woman was killed and her body was found. The victim had several gunshots. There are no further details on the attack or potential perpetrators, but the region is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); Women (Colombia); Refugees/IDPs (Colombia); PH: Historic Pact for Colombia
notes: On 7 February 2022, in Bogota - Kennedy (Bogota, D.C.), four unidentified armed individuals attacked the vehicle of a woman social leader and activist when the victim was returning to her house. A security vehicle and bodyguards were assigned to the victim due to previous attacks. The perpetrators intercepted the car, opened fire, and attempted to open the doors. The victim's bodyguard reacted by using the vehicle to ram the perpetrators, who then fled the area. Although the authorities stated that the incident could be related to a robbery, the victim remarked that she had received multiple death threats because of her work with communities in the Bolivar department, where she was a victim of forced displacement. Moreover, the victim is a running candidate for Congress for a left coalition political party PH (Pacto Historico). There were no fatalities. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders].

Around 7 February 2022 (as reported), near Tierralta municipality (Cordoba), two young men were killed and their bodies were found in the 9 Agosto neighborhood and the Rural area of El Rosario, respectively. Residents fear that the attacks are related to social cleansing carried out by an armed group, as in both incidents pamphlets were found stating that the victims were killed for their involvement in robberies. Residents claimed that this is the modus operandi of the self-defense groups, but this version has not been confirmed. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 2 fatalities.

On 7 February 2022, in Remedios (Antioquia), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed two people in the Matadero neighborhood. There are no further details on the attack or potential perpetrators, but the region is known for the presence of armed groups. 2 fatalities.

On 7 February 2022, in El Carmen De Bolivar (Bolivar), one person was killed and between two to three more were injured in a drive-by shooting. Perpetrators broke into a house and opened fire on the group. Although perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 7 February 2022, in Tarapaca municipality (Amazonas), an unidentified armed group killed two indigenous people. There are no further details on the attack or potential perpetrators. 2 fatalities.

Around 7 February 2022 (as reported), in Titiribi (Antioquia), a person was killed by unidentified armed individuals. The attack triggered the displacement of 60 residents from the area. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. There are no further details on the attack or potential perpetrators. 1 fatality.

Around 7 February 2022, in Tame (Arauca), unidentified armed individuals shot two people in two separate drive-by shooting incidents. In the Santander neighborhood, unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle opened fire on a man, causing severe injuries. The victim was hospitalized. In the second incident, in the Barrio del Llano, perpetrators opened fire on the victim who died in the location. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 7 February 2022, in Buenaventura (Valle del Cauca), unidentified armed individuals broke into the house of a moto-taxi driver and shot dead the victim in the 12 Abril neighborhood. There are no further details on potential perpetrators. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 7 February 2022, in Sabaletas corregimiento (Valle del Cauca), a man was killed and his body was found. The victim was shot several times. There are no further details on the attack or potential perpetrators, but the region is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 5 February 2022 (weekend of), in Urrao (Antioquia), a man was killed and another was injured in a drive-by shooting in the 20 de Julio neighborhood. Around 5 February 2022 (weekend of), in the rural area of Urrao municipality (Antioquia), a man was killed and his body was found in the El Llano area. Around 5 February 2022, near La Montanita municipality (Caqueta), a man was shot and killed by unidentified perpetrators. There are no further details on the attack or potential perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 4 February 2022, in the rural area of Condoto municipality (Choco), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a young man. There are no further details on potential perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

source: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz; INDEPAZ
notes: On 2 February 2022, in the rural area of Yurilla corregimiento (Putumayo), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed three community members, among them a social leader, in the el Balsal area. Some sources indicate that the bodies show signs of torture and burns. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 3 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action
notes: On 2 February 2022, in the rural area of Cabuyaro municipality (Meta), four armed individuals shot and killed a social leader who was also a member of the JAC from the San Miguel vereda in a drive-by shooting. Perpetrators opened fire against the victim at his private house. The victim had reported previous death threats. Further investigations claimed the Gulf clan was responsible for perpetrating the attack. 1 fatality.

Around 2 February 2022, in Corinto (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a person in a drive-by shooting in the Pedro Leon neighborhood. Although the perpetrators of the attack have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action; Labour Group (Colombia)
source: Vanguardia Liberal; El Tiempo (Colombia); INDEPAZ; El Colombiano
notes: On 1 February 2022, in Corocito (Arauca), unidentified armed individuals broke into the house of a social leader and abducted the victim. The man was a member of the local JAC and a renowned business owner from the area. Although perpetrators of the attack have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of ELN and FARC dissident factions. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown.

assoc_actor_2: AICO: Indigenous Authorities of Colombia; Government of Colombia (2018-2022); Indigenous Group (Colombia); Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
notes: On 1 February 2022, in the rural area of Cordoba municipality (Narino), unidentified armed individuals broke into the house of an indigenous leader, who was a councilman of the AICO political party, and shot him dead. The attack occurred in the Guitungal vereda, nearly 15 minutes from the municipal seat. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
notes: Around 31 January 2022 (as reported), in San Jose de la Fragua (Caqueta), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a former FARC member in the El Centro neighborhood. Perpetrators opened fire on the victim as the latter was in a local bar. The area is known for the presence of FARC dissident factions and Gulf Clan members. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); Farmers (Colombia); MP: Patriotic March
source: UNOCHA; INDEPAZ; El Espectador; El Tiempo (Colombia)
notes: On 31 January 2022, in the rural area of Caloto municipality (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a farmer, who was also a social leader of his community and an active member of the MP political party. Perpetrators searched for the victim at the El Placer vereda and opened fire on him. The victim had requested police surveillance due to increasing death threats against him. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 31 January 2022, in the rural area of Titiribi municipality (Antioquia), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a businessman in a drive-by shooting. Four armed men on motorcycles intercepted the victim's vehicle and opened fire on the passengers, killing the victim and injuring his son. The driver survived the attack. There are no further details on potential perpetrators or threats made against the victims who were owners of a local mine. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: On 31 January 2022, in Villavicencio (Meta), four armed individuals killed an off-duty police officer in the Villa Samper neighborhood in a drive-by shooting. The perpetrators opened fire on the victim, who was approaching his home at the time. Subsequently, they left a pamphlet on which a dissident FARC faction claimed responsibility for the attack. 1 fatality.

On 31 January 2022, in the rural area of Amaga (Antioquia), unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle shot at two men, father and son, in a drive-by shooting on the Amaga - Titiribi road. One man was killed and the other was injured and taken to the hospital. Both victims were miners. The motive of the attack is unknown. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
notes: On 30 January 2022, in Saravena (Arauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a former FARC member in a drive-by shooting. The victim was hospitalized but died due to the severity of the wounds. Although the perpetrators of the attack have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
source: El Espectador; UNOCHA; El Heraldo (Colombia); INDEPAZ
notes: Around 29 January 2022, in the rural area of Santa Marta municipality (Magdalena), a former FARC member was killed and his body was found in the Matogiro vereda. The victim's body was found by local workers at Hacienda Tayrona with several gunshot wounds. There are no further details about the attack or the possible perpetrators, but there is presence of Gulf Clan member in the area. 1 fatality.

On 29 January 2022, in Andalucia (Valle del Cauca), police forces opened fire on a civilian's vehicle after the driver ignored an officer's stop sign in a suspected case of police brutality. A car chase ensued, and officers opened fire, injuring the driver, who crashed his car. Although the victim was hospitalized, he later died due to the severity of his injuries. 1 fatality.

On 29 January 2022, in Buenaventura (Valle del Cauca), an Afro-Colombian man was shot and killed in the Independencia neighborhood. The motive and perpetrators of the attack are unknown, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

source: El Espectador; El Tiempo (Colombia); INDEPAZ; UNOCHA; La Patria
notes: On 28 January 2022, in the rural area of Buenos Aires (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals broke into a private residence and killed three members of the same family in Santa Catalina vereda. Another child who was in the house was wounded. Although the perpetrators of the attack have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 3 fatalities.

On 28 January 2022, in Dabeiba (Antioquia), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a young Embera indigenous person from the Amparrado indigenous reserve area. Although the perpetrators of the attack have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of Gulf Clan members and ELN. 1 fatality.

Around 28 January 2022, in Medellin (Antioquia), a man member of the LGBT community was killed and his body was found at his house in the Antonio Narino neighborhood. The victim was naked and tied up. LGBT collectives denounced that this is the third incident of similar characteristics in which a member of the community is killed and called for a prompt police investigation of the incidents alleging possible hate killings. 1 fatality.

Around 27 January 2022, in the rural area of El Tambo (Cauca), two men were killed and their bodies were found near the El Asomadero area. Both victims were shot in the head and one had his hands tied. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 2 fatalities.

actor1: FARC Dissident - 62nd Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (62nd Front - Fernando Diaz)
source: UNOCHA; Diario La Libertad; El Espectador
notes: On 26 January 2022, in the rural area of San Vicente Del Caguan (Caqueta), members of the 62nd FARC dissident Front - Fernando Diaz attacked a tank cars' motorcade that was driving between San Vicente del Caguan and Puerto Rico municipality. Perpetrators also used explosives during the incident, resulting in one driver killed and several litters of petroleum spilled. 1 fatality.

Around 26 January 2022, in the rural area of Santa Maria corregimiento (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals abducted two civilians. The victim's bodies were later found with several signs of torture near the Consejo Comunitario Renacer Negro Timbiqui municipality. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 2 fatalities.

On 26 January 2022, near Palomino corregimiento (La Guajira), unidentified individuals set fire to several houses and a religious center from the Kogui indigenous people. Indigenous people expressed their concerns that the attack may be related to their opposition to the development of extraction projects inside their territories. Indigenous people claimed that several children were injured due to the fire.

Around 26 January 2022, near Campo Seis (Norte de Santander), a Venezuelan man was killed and his body was found. The victim was shot in the head and his body had several signs of torture, and his hands were tied. The man used to cross the border to Colombia to buy food for his family. There are no further details about the attack or the possible perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of 33rd FARC dissidents members and ELN. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
source: El Universal (Colombia); El Espectador; Vanguardia Liberal; INDEPAZ; ReliefWeb
notes: On 26 January 2022, in the rural area of Saravena municipality (Arauca), unidentified armed individuals broke into a funeral in Las Pavas vereda and killed the wife of a social leader who was killed on January 25 (coded separately). The perpetrators arrived at the residence on a motorcycle, fired shots at the victim, and subsequently fled the area. The area is known for the presence of the 10th FARC dissident front, ELN, and Venezuelan gangs. A subsequent investigation suggested that a FARC dissident faction killed the victim after accusing her to aid the ELN. 1 fatality. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

Around 25 January 2022, at the border of Colombia and Venezuela, in Cucuta (Norte de Santander), three men, one Venezuelan and two Colombians, were killed and their bodies were found in the Escobal Viejo neighborhood. The victims were smuggling migrants at different sides of the border with Venezuela. Authorities believe the victims were killed in Venezuela and then their bodies were brought to Colombia. However, it is not clear on which side of the border they were actually killed. Although the authorship of the attack has not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of FARC dissident faction number 33, ELN, EPL, Tren de Aragua, Los Rastrojos, and EPL. 3 fatalities.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: Around 25 January 2022, in the rural area Ocana municipality (Norte de Santander), a man was killed and his body was found near Venadillo vereda. Near the body, police found a sign stating the victim had been killed in a social cleansing by a FARC dissident faction. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
source: El Espectador; El Colombiano; INDEPAZ; ReliefWeb
notes: On 25 January 2022, in the rural area of Tame municipality (Arauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a social leader from the Saravena municipality. The victim was a communal leader from La Union. Witnesses claim perpetrators arrived at the area looking for the victim. A subsequent investigation suggested that a FARC dissident faction killed the victim after accusing him to aid the ELN. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Jaime Martinez: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Jaime Martinez)
assoc_actor_2: Indigenous Group (Colombia); Guardia Indigena (Colombia); Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
notes: On 24 January 2022, in the rural area of Las Delicias (Cauca), suspected members of the Jaime Martinez FARC dissident faction shot and killed a social leader who was also a former leader of a local Guardia Indigena. The perpetrators searched for the victim in his private residence and shot him dead. On the same day, the FARC dissidents opened fire on several civilians after members of the Guardia Indigena expelled a guerrilla unit from the indigenous reserve area in Los Mandarinos. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Jaime Martinez: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Jaime Martinez)
notes: Around 24 January 2022, in the rural area of Las Delicias (Cauca), suspected members of the Jaime Martinez FARC dissident faction abducted two children in an indigenous reserve zone. One victim is the son of a social leader killed by the armed group in the past 24 hours (coded separately). The armed group released both victims an hour later after the community organized and chased the perpetrators to demand the release of the children. There were no injuries.

source: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz; UNOCHA
notes: On 24 January 2022, in the rural area of Puerto Caicedo (Putumayo), suspected members of the CDF killed a moto-taxi driver. Residents claim the CDF had restricted the circulation of motorcycles in the area since 10 January. 1 fatality.

source: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz; UNOCHA
notes: On 24 January 2022, in the rural area of Puerto Guzman (Putumayo), two suspected members of the CDF killed a civilian, who was the husband of Las Perlas community's secretary. Residents claim the CDF had restricted the circulation of motorcycles in the area since 10 January. 1 fatality.

Around 24 January 2022, in Tibu (Norte de Santander), a person was killed and his body was found in the Villa Paz neighborhood. The victim was shot two times. There are no further details about the attack or the possible perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of 33rd FARC dissidents members and ELN. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Colombia); Labour Group (Colombia); Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
notes: Around 24 January 2022 (as reported), in Peque (Antioquia), farmers were victims of torture by members of the military forces who sought to get information related to members of armed groups. Local authorities claim the victims reported electroshocks and other torture methods. There were no fatalities.

On 24 January 2022, in Medellin (Antioquia), police officers shot a man in a suspected case of police brutality. Police chased and opened fire on the victim when he refused to stop his motorcycle at a police checkpoint. The victim died after the bullet struck the back of his head. 1 fatality.

On 24 January 2022, in La Union (La Union, Antioquia), a man driving a motorcycle was shot and killed by unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle in a drive-by shooting. The motive of the attack is unknown. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 23 January 2022, in Saravena (Arauca), unidentified armed individuals abducted three men from the Puerto Narino area. Perpetrators broke into a store and forced the victims into a vehicle, subsequently fleeing the area. Although the authorship of the attack has not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. The whereabouts of the victims are still unknown.

On 23 January 2022, in Saravena municipality (Arauca), on two separate incidents, unidentified armed individuals shot and killed two people in a drive-by shooting. There are no further details about the attacks or the possible perpetrators, but there is a presence of dissident FARC factions and ELN members in the area. Resident claim there were connections between the attack and these armed groups, but this information has not been confirmed. 2 fatalities.

On 23 January 2022, in Arauca (Arauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a civilian in a drive-by shooting. There are no further details about the attack or the possible perpetrators, but there is a presence of dissident FARC factions and ELN members in the area. Witnesses claim there were connections between the attack and these armed groups, but this information has not been confirmed. 1 fatality.

On 23 January 2022, in Arauquita (Arauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a resident in a drive-by shooting. There are no further details about the attack or the possible perpetrators, but there is a presence of dissident FARC factions and ELN members in the area. Residents claimed there were connections between the attack and these armed groups, but this information has not been confirmed. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); Women (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action
source: El Tiempo (Colombia); UNOCHA; INDEPAZ; El Espectador; El Colombiano
notes: Around 23 January 2022, in the rural area of Argelia municipality (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals abducted a woman social leader, who was also a member of the local JAC, and her husband from their private residence in the Llano Alto vereda. Locals later found the victim's body with several wounds in the village of El Plateado. The whereabouts of her partner are still unknown. The area is known for the presence of ELN and FARC dissident Factions. 1 fatality. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

Around 23 January 2022, in the rural area of Candelaria municipality (Valle del Cauca), two unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle attacked a political candidate member of the PH political coalition. The perpetrators followed the victim after a meeting in the town, forced him to stop his vehicle, and then beat him up. The victim claimed that the perpetrators expressed that they were attacking him since he supported a 'guerrilla movement' and candidate Gustavo Petro (who is a former guerrilla member). They then claimed they would kill him if he did not stop being part of the political coalition. There were no fatalities.

On 23 January 2022, in the rural area of Albania municipality (La Guajira), unidentified armed individuals abducted the municipality's Secretary of Treasury. Perpetrators waited for the victim near his private residence in the Porciosa corregimiento, then forced him into a different vehicle with a Venezuelan license plates and fled the area. The victim had not reported any previous threats. The whereabouts of the victim are still unknown.

On 23 January 2022, in Puerto Raudal (Antioquia), a woman was shot and killed by unidentified armed individuals. The motive of the attack is un known. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

Around 23 January 2022, in the rural area of Belalcazar (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot dead a former member of the military forces. The victim was visiting his family when the perpetrators attacked him. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 23 January 2022, in the rural area of Guatemala corregimiento (Cauca), two men were killed and their bodies were found shot to death. There are no further details on the attack or potential perpetrators. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 2 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Colombia); Labour Group (Colombia); Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
source: Vanguardia Liberal; El Colombiano; El Tiempo (Colombia)
notes: On 22 January 2022, in Botalon (Arauca), unidentified armed individuals abducted four civilians who were in a bar in the area. Witnesses claim the perpetrators tied up the victims, forced them into a vehicle, and then fled the area. Among the victims were a farmer, two local workers, and a local community leader. On January 23, military forces reported that the armed group had released the victims without injury. Local authorities claim the ELN was responsible for the incident, but this information has not been confirmed. The area is known for the presence of armed groups.

On 22 January 2022, in Fortul municipality (Arauca), a person was killed and his body was found on a road that connects Fortul and La Esmeralda. There are no further details about the attacks or the possible perpetrators, but there is a presence of dissident FARC factions and ELN members in the area. Witnesses claim there were connections between the attack and these armed groups, but this information has not been confirmed. 1 fatality.

On 22 January 2022, in the rural area of Puerto Cachicamo corregimiento (Guaviare), military officers opened fire at a group of civilians who were demanding them to leave the area in the Nueva Colombia vereda. There were no casualties.

Around 21 January 2022, in the rural area of Cucuta municipality (Norte de Santander), a person was killed and his body was found on the road linking Cucuta and Faustino. The victim was shot several times. There are no further details about the attack or the possible perpetrators. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 21 January 2022, in Puerto Lleras (Norte de Santander), two men were killed and their bodies were found. The victims were shot several times, one of which was a Venezuelan national. Witnesses claim an armed group opened fire at the victims when they passed driving a stolen motorcycle, but this version has not been confirmed. The area is known for the presence of the Gulf Clan and the ELN. 2 fatalities.

Around 21 January 2022, in the rural area of Puerto Santander (Norte de Santander), a person was killed and his body was found in El Dave vereda. The victim, who was a Venezuelan national, was shot two times in the head. There are no further details about the attack or the possible perpetrators. The area is known for the presence of Gulf Clan members and ELN. 1 fatality.

On 21 January 2022, in Cucuta (Norte de Santander), two unidentified armed individuals shot and killed an off-duty police officer on the Prados del Este sector. The motive of the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 20 January 2022 (as reported), in the rural area of Ocana municipality (Norte de Santander), three members of the same family were shot and killed and their bodies were found near Las Chircas corregimiento. One of the victims was the brother of the former president of the Council of Communal Action (JAC) of the Palmarito corregimiento. Also, all the victims had denounced clashes between an armed group and military forces in the past. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 3 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action
notes: Around 20 January 2022, in the rural area of Puerto Guzman (Putumayo), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed three people, among them a member of the local JAC. Perpetrators dragged the victims out of their private residence and shot them dead on the street. The incident triggered the displacement of 14 people, residents in the area. Although perpetrators have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 3 fatalities.

source: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz
notes: Around 20 January 2022 (as reported), in Buenaventura municipality, two people were shot and killed and their bodies were found floating near the Puerto Pizario indigenous reserve. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 2 fatalities.

Around 20 January 2022 (as reported), in Cucuta (Norte de Santander), a man was shot and killed and his body was found in an illegal passing in the Bocono sector. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); Afro-Colombian Ethnic Group (Colombia)
notes: On 20 January 2022, in the rural area of Barbacoas municipality (Narino), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed an Afro-Colombian social leader near the Playa de Telpi area. Perpetrators intercepted the victim's boat going in the direction to the municipal seat of Barbacoas, forced all passengers out of the vehicle, and subsequently opened fire at the victim, killing him. The victim was the leader of the community council of San Miguel de Nambi vereda. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

Around 20 January 2022 (as reported), in Litoral del San Juan municipality (Choco), two people were killed and their bodies were found near the Puerto Pizario indigenous reserve. The motive and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 2 fatalities.

On 20 January 2022, in El Cerrito (Valle del Cauca), a man was shot and killed by an unidentified armed individual on a bicycle in a drive-by shooting. The motive of the attack is unknown. The department is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 19 January 2022, in the rural area of Arauca municipality (Arauca), a social leader, who is also a human rights defender, was shot and killed by unidentified armed individuals in near the Clarinetero vereda. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.
On 19 January 2022, in Saravena (Arauca), two Venezuelan men were killed by unidentified armed individuals. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 2 fatalities.

On 19 January 2022, in Maicao (La Guajira), two unidentified armed individuals in a motorcycle shot at a group of Wayuu indigenous men in a drive-by shooting. One man was killed and other three were injured. 1 fatality.

On 19 January 2022, in Riohacha (La Guajira), a Wayuu indigenous man was shot and killed by two unidentified armed individuals moving in a motorcycle in a drive-by shooting. The motive of the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 18 January 2022 (as reported), in the rural area of El Carmen de Viboral municipality (Antioquia), a social leader, who was also a teacher, was shot in the dead and killed and his body was found in the Campo Alegre vereda. The victim had denounced the activity of armed groups in the past and was also an environmental activist. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

source: UNOCHA; El Tiempo (Colombia); INDEPAZ; El Colombiano
notes: On 18 January 2022, in the rural area of Santo Domingo municipality (Antioquia), four members from the same family were killed and their bodies were found in the Las Beatrices vereda. Perpetrators broke into the victim's house and shot them dead. The area is known for the presence of several armed groups. 4 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); Health Workers (Colombia); Farmers (Colombia); Women (Colombia)
source: INDEPAZ; El Colombiano; El Espectador; UNOCHA; El Tiempo (Colombia)
notes: Around 18 January 2022, near Orocue municipality (Meta), a woman social leader was killed and her body was found in a local river. Family members reported the victim missing on January 12 after she left her home in rural Puerto Gaitan (Meta). Witnesses saw the victim in Orocue later that day, after which there are no further clues as to her whereabouts. The woman was a well-known doctor in her community and a leader of a farmers' organization. She had reported previous threats due to her work with the communities. Although the perpetrators of the attack have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

source: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz
notes: Around 18 January 2022 (as reported), in the rural area of Puerto Leguizamo (Putumayo), a man was shot and killed and his body was found with his throat slit in the Pinuna Negro sector. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

On 18 January 2022, in the rural area of San Luis municipality (San Luis, Antioquia), a couple on a motorcycle was shot and killed by unidentified armed individuals also on a motorcycle in a drive-by shooting in Naranjales vereda. The motive of the attack is unknown. The department is known for the presence of armed groups. 2 fatalities.

Around 18 January 2022, in the rural area of El Tambo (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a local farmer in the Las botas vereda. Although perpetrators of the attack have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

source: INDEPAZ; Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz

They also burned a house. 3 fatalities.
On 17 January 2022, in Arauquita municipality (Arauca), a man was killed by unidentified armed individuals. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

source: ReliefWeb; Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz
notes: On 17 January 2022, in Bajo Calima (Valle del Cauca), Gulf Clan members killed five people, including an Afro-Colombian man near the port. The activity of the armed group has also affected the communities of Ka Colonia and San Isidro and triggered the confinement of nearly 2,487 residents. 5 fatalities.

On 17 January 2022, in La Union (Valle del Cauca), unidentified armed individuals killed a local businesswoman in a drive-by shooting in the Popular neighborhood. Perpetrators approached the victim while she was at a local fishing club, opened fire, and subsequently fled the area. The victim owned a local store that sale party supplies. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: On 17 January 2022, in Arauquita (Arauca), a social leader, who was also a member of a farmer's association, was shot and killed by unidentified armed individuals in the La Libertad neighborhood. A subsequent investigation suggested that a FARC dissident faction killed the victim. 1 fatality.

On 17 January 2022, in El Bordo (Cauca), a Venezuelan man was shot and killed by an unidentified armed individual. The motive of the attack is unknown. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 17 January 2022, in the rural area of Santiago de Cali (Valle del Cauca), unidentified armed individuals attacked the house of a woman environmental activist in the Los Farellones area. Perpetrators threw explosives and opened fire on the victim's residence. The victim fled the attack uninjured. There were no fatalities. On 16 January 2022, in La Union (Valle del Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the La Flora neighborhood. There are no further details on the attack or potential perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 16 January 2022, in the rural area of Monteria (Cordoba), one civilian was killed in a suspected case of police brutality in the Los Garzones area. The victim was shot four times by an officer after the patrol attended a call for a domestic incident. Police sources claimed the victim tried to attack the officers with a machete knife. The incident triggered a town riot (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 16 January 2022, in Toribio (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a person in the Belen neighborhood. Perpetrators raided a public bar and shot dead the victim. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or attack motivation, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 16 January 2022, in the rural area of Toribio municipality (Cauca), a man was killed and his body was found. Near the body, perpetrators left a sign claiming the victim was killed for blackmailing members of the community. Although perpetrators of the attack have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 15 January 2022, in Dipurdu Del Guasimo (Choco), Gulf Clan raided the corregimiento and opened fire on civilians' houses killing between two to three people, among them a 10-year-old child. The incident triggered the displacement of 1,500 residents from the area. At least 2 fatalities.

Around 15 January 2022 (weekend of), in La Union (Valle del Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed two people in a drive-by shooting in the Popular neighborhood. Perpetrators opened fire on the victims when they were in a local bar. One of the victims was the bar owner. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 2 fatalities.

Around 15 January 2022, in Buenaventura (Valle del Cauca), unidentified armed individuals broke into the house of a local liquor dealer in the Ciudadela Nueva neighborhood and shot him dead. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or attack motivation, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: Around 14 January 2022 (as reported), in Pan de Azucar (Cauca), a man was killed and his body was found. Next to the body, there was a sign authored by a FARC Dissident group in which criminal activities are reported and they announced social cleansing. The sign read 'We have already located the rest of the thieves, vicious and drug dealers. We are after all. FARC EP'. 1 fatality.

Around 14 January 2022 (as reported), in the Palmira La Negra corregimiento (Sucre), two people were killed and their bodies were found in the road that connects the Algarrobal and Castillo sectors. There is presence of the Gulf Clan in the area. 2 fatalities.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Jaime Martinez: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Jaime Martinez)
assoc_actor_2: Nasa Indigenous Group (Colombia); Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
source: Vanguardia Liberal; El Tiempo (Colombia); El Colombiano; La Patria; INDEPAZ; Twitter
notes: On 14 January 2022, near Las Delicias indigenous reserve (Cauca), around 11 members of the FARC Dissident group Jaime Martinez Front shot and threw explosive devices at members of the Guardia Indigena of the Nasa indigenous community. Two indigenous men were killed: a social leader, and a minor, who was also an environmental activist. Five men were injured. There is presence of several armed groups in the area. 2 fatalities.

On 14 January 2022, in Miranda (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals opened fire against a group of civilians who had gathered in the Las Gradas de la Plazoleta neighborhood, killing a man and a woman. Reports claimed the attack is related to a social cleansing carried out by an armed group. 2 fatalities.

On 14 January 2022, in the rural area of Miranda municipality (Cauca), a man was killed and his body was found in the Guatemala vereda. Near the body, perpetrators left a sign claiming the victim was killed for robbing residents. The killing is related to social cleansing. There is also the presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Afro-Colombian Ethnic Group (Colombia); Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); Farmers (Colombia)
notes: Around 14 January 2022 (as reported), in San Miguel (Choco), an Afro-Colombian social leader, who was also a farmer, was killed and his body was found. The victim had been kidnapped in his community by unidentified armed individuals four days before (coded separately). There is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

On 14 January 2022, in the rural area of El Tambo municipality (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a disabled man inside his home in El Cipres vereda. The motive and perpetrators of the attack are unknown but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 13 January 2022, in Cartagena (Bolivar), unidentified armed individuals opened fire on a group of civilians during a funeral in the Jardines de Cartagena cemetery in a drive-by shooting, killing one person and injuring another. Authorities attributed the attack to members of the Gulf Clan and claimed that the victim was mistaken for a member of the armed group. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident - 33rd Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (33rd Front)
source: El Tiempo (Colombia); La Opinion (Colombia); El Espectador
notes: On 13 January 2022, near Tibu municipality (Norte de Santander), an oil engineer working for the state-owned company ECOPETROL was kidnapped by at least two armed members of the FARC Dissident group 33rd Front. The victim was kidnapped while being at work. The victim was released uninjured by the perpetrators on 4 February.

Around 13 January 2022, in the rural area of Pueblo Bello municipality (Cesar), unidentified armed individuals wearing military gear shot and killed a farmer in the Minas de Iracal corregimiento. Perpetrators searched for the victim at his private residence. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 13 January 2022, in the rural area of Barbacoas municipality (Narino), unidentified armed individuals abducted an Awa indigenous man from his residence in the El Mero area, from the Gran Sabalo indigenous reserve area. The whereabouts of the victim are still unknown. The area is known for the presence of armed groups.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Carlos Patino Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Carlos Patino Front)
notes: Around 13 January 2022 (as reported), in the rural area of El Tambo municipality (Cauca), a truck driver was shot and killed by members the FARC Dissident group Carlos Patino Front in the Cana Agria sector. Pamphlets referring to the dissident group were found in the area. The Dissidents also burned down the truck. 1 fatality.

Around 12 January 2022 (as reported), in Banco de Arenas corregimiento (Norte de Santander), two men were shot and killed and their bodies were found in the Miraflores vereda. There is presence of armed groups in that area. 2 fatalities.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Jaime Martinez: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Jaime Martinez)
source: UNOCHA; El Tiempo (Colombia); Diario La Libertad; El Pais (Colombia)
notes: On 12 January 2022, in Jamundi municipality (Valle del Cauca), a woman was kidnapped by members of the FARC Dissident group Jaime Martinez Front in the road to the Rio Claro sector. The woman was rescued by military forces 12 hours later. Three kidnappers were arrested.

Around 12 January 2022 (as reported), in the rural area of El Carmen de Bolivar (Bolivar), a farmer was killed by unidentified armed individuals in the Soltones de Meza sector. There is presence of the Gulf Clan in the area, which has been threatening the population and ordering who to vote for in the next elections. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Jaime Martinez: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Jaime Martinez)
notes: On 12 January 2022, in the rural area of Jamundi municipality (Valle del Cauca), three armed individuals who identified themselves as members of the dissident faction of the FARC Jaime Martinez kidnapped a businesswoman. The victim was released that same day in a police operation in the municipality of Yumbo. Authorities believed that the perpetrators could be linked to the Gulf Clan, but the men denied any links to the Gulf Clan.

On 12 January 2022, in Cartagena (Bolivar), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Los Caballos 'champe' area. Authorities stated that members of the Gulf Clan are responsible for the attack and that the incident is part of the armed group's attempt to control illegal economies in the city. The victim had a police record. 1 fatality.

Around 12 January 2022 (week of), in the rural area of Banco De Arenas corregimiento (Norte de Santander), two men were killed and their bodies were found in the El Infierno area. The victims were shot dead. Although the perpetrators of the attack have not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of the ELN and Gulf Clan members. 2 fatalities.

Around 12 January 2022 (as reported), near El Pital corregimiento (Cauca), a member of an indigenous community was shot and killed and his body was found with his hands tied in the road that leads to the seat of the municipality. 1 fatality.

Around 12 January 2022 (as reported), in the rural area of Sucre municipality (Cauca), a couple were shot and killed and their bodies were found in La Predregosa vereda. Their bodies were taken to the municipal morgue by residents of the area who found the bodies. The motives of the attack are unknown. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 2 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia; Farmers (Colombia)
notes: On 11 January 2022, near the Chengue corregimiento (Sucre), a demobilized former FARC member, who was also a farmer, was shot and killed in the road to El Tesoro vereda. The victim's throat was slit. There is presence of the Gulf Clan in the area, which has been threatening the population and ordering who to vote for in the next elections. 1 fatality.

Around 11 January 2022 (as reported), near the Sevillano corregimiento (Magdalena), a man was killed and his body was found with gunshot wounds and with a sign that read 'AGC present, for having a big mouth and snitching'. The attack was attributed to the Gulf Clan. 1 fatality.

On 11 January 2022, in Uribia (La Guajira), the son of the former mayor of the town was killed by unidentified armed individuals in a drive-by shooting outside of his house in Aipiamana neighborhood. 1 fatality.

On 11 January 2022, in Cartagena (Bolivar), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Los Corales area. Authorities stated that members of the Gulf Clan responsible for the attack and that the incident is part of the armed group's attempt to control illegal economies in the city. The victim had police records. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Arhuaco Indigenous Group (Colombia); Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
notes: On 11 January 2022, in the rural area of Pueblo Bello municipality (Cesar), Arhuaco indigenous militia detained two Arhuaco indigenous leaders from the Sey Ati Gunaruwun community. Community members claimed that the detention is related to political persecution by an Arhuaco indigenous governor who has rejected the community's decision to elect new authorities.

Around 11 January 2022 (as reported), in Choco department (coded to Quibdo), armed individuals attacked with gunshots at the house of a congressman from the departmental assembly. The victim was inside the house with his family at the moment of the attack. Hours later, armed individuals threw an explosive device at the house of another congress representative. One of the victims claimed the ELN was responsible for the attack. There were no casualties.

On 10 January 2022, in Coloso (Sucre), a woman social leader was killed by unidentified armed individuals. There is presence of the Gulf Clan in the area, which has been threatening the population and ordering who to vote for in the next elections. 1 fatality. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 10 January 2022, in Cartagena (Bolivar), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed an online mobility platform driver. Witnesses claimed two men on a motorcycle followed the victim, and after a small exchange, they shot him dead. Authorities stated that members of the Gulf Clan are responsible for the attack and that the incident is part of the armed group's attempt to control illegal economies in the city. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Afro-Colombian Ethnic Group (Colombia); Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); Farmers (Colombia)
notes: On 10 January 2022, around Andagoya, in Medio San Juan municipality (Choco), an Afro-Colombian social leader, who was also a farmer, was abducted by unidentified armed individuals in the Paimado community. The body of the victim was found four days later (coded separately). At least 130 Afro-Colombian residents were displaced due to the presence of armed men in the locality. There is a presence of several armed groups in the area.

Around 10 January 2022 (as reported), in Buenaventura municipality (Valle del Cauca), a man who was driving a motorcycle was shot and killed by a navy officer after not stopping at a checkpoint in the road that goes to the local airport. 1 fatality.
On 9 January 2022, in Santa Marta (Magdalena), the brother of the hitmen leader of Los Pachencas Gang was killed by unidentified armed individuals in the Once de November neighborhood. 1 fatality.

Around 9 January 2022 (as reported), in the rural area of Puerto Santander municipality (Norte de Santander), a man was killed and his body was found with signs of violence in the Vegas del Pamplonita vereda. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

Around 9 January 2022 (as reported), in Tibu (Norte de Santander), a man was killed and his body was found with a sign that read 'For Snitching Sijin' in the Siete de Abril neighborhood. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

On 8 January 2022, in the rural area of San Onofre municipality (Sucre), a man was killed by unidentified armed individuals in the Berlin vereda. The victim had received threats from the Gulf Clan in the past, which is why it is believed they are the perpetrators. He was also involved in the killing of a man, although no further information about the event was reported. 1 fatality.

On 8 January 2022, in Villanueva (Narino), three people were shot and killed by unidentified armed individuals in the main square. Other four people were injured. There is presence of several armed groups in the area. 3 fatalities.

source: INDEPAZ; Diario La Libertad; El Heraldo (Colombia); El Tiempo (Colombia)
notes: On 8 January 2022, in Julio Zawady corregimiento (Magdalena), a couple and their child were killed by suspected Gulf Clan members, who arrived on motorcycles, inside their house in El Salon vereda. One of the perpetrators was arrested on 19 July 2022. 3 fatalities.

On 8 January 2022, in the rural area of Salgar municipality (Antioquia), two social leaders were killed in the Yaruma vereda. One of the victims was a representative of a coffee farmers association. 2 fatalities.

On 8 January 2022, in Buenaventura (Valle del Cauca), a man was shot and killed by unidentified perpetrators in the Rockefeller neighborhood. The motive of the attack is unknown. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 7 January 2022 (as reported), in the vicinity of the Monterrey corregimiento, in the rural area of Simiti municipality (Bolivar), a man was killed and his body was found with 32 gunshot wounds to the body near the Cuadros vereda. There is presence of the ELN in the area. 1 fatality.

Around 7 January 2022, in the rural area of Barbacoas municipality (Narino), two Awa indigenous women were killed and their bodies were found. The victims had disappeared in December 2021. It remains unclear the details of the incident, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 2 fatalities.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: Around 7 January 2022 (as reported), in the rural area of Tulua municipality (Valle del Cauca) two men were killed and their bodies were found near the San Lorenzo vereda. The two victims were moving in a motorcycle when they were intercepted by unidentified armed men. Near the bodies was found propaganda related to FARC Dissidents. 2 fatalities.

On 6 January 2022, in Mani municipality (Casanare), unidentified armed men shot and killed three people and injured another inside their house. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 3 fatalities.

On 6 January 2022, in La Union (Valle del Cauca), unidentified individuals broke the windows and set on fire the house of a councilwoman. The councilwoman was inside the house with her children. There were no casualties. [women targeted: government officials]

Around 6 January 2022 (as reported), in Caucasia (Antioquia), a man was shot and killed and his body was found in a softball field. The motive of the attack is unknown. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

On 6 January 2022, in Buenaventura (Valle del Cauca), an Afro-Colombian man was shot and killed by unknown perpetrators in the Alfonso Lopez Pumarejo neighborhood. The motive of the attack is unknown. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 5 January 2022, in the rural area of Ituango municipality (Antioquia), Gulf Clan members killed the uncle of a FARC Dissident commander of the 18th Front in Las Aranas vereda. The victim attended a meeting with the Gulf Clan members and after saying that he was not leaving his land, he was killed. 1 fatality.

Around 5 January 2022 (week of), in Buenaventura municipality (Valle del Cauca), unidentified armed individuals kidnapped five people. The armed group later communicated with the families of the victims informing them that they were killed and only women members of the family should retrieve their bodies, but no further information was provided and bodies were not seen yet. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 5 fatalities.
Around 4 January 2022 (as reported), in Petrolea (Norte de Santander), a man was killed an his body was found with three gunshot wounds. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

Around 4 January 2022 (as reported), in the rural area of Tibu municipality (Norte de Santander), a man was killed an his body was found with two gunshot wounds and with a sign on the chest that read 'X pabaco' in the Bertrania vereda. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

On 4 January 2022, in Cartagena (Bolivar), unidentified armed individuals opened fire on a group of civilians who had gathered in a local park in a drive-by shooting incident in the Palmeritas neighborhood, killing one person. Authorities stated that members of the Gulf Clan are responsible for the attack and that the events are part of the armed group's attempt to control illegal economies in the city. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Guardia Indigena (Colombia); Indigenous Group (Colombia); Zenu Indigenous Group (Colombia); Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
notes: On 4 January 2022, in Caucasia (Antioquia), unidentified armed individuals attacked a Zenu indigenous person who was also a member of the Guardia Indigena from the Tigre 1 community. There are no further details on the attack, but the area is known for the presence of the Gulf Clan and ELN. The victim fled the incident unharmed. There were no fatalities.

On 4 January 2022, in Bogota - San Cristobal (Bogota, D.C.), two trans women were sexually harassed while in police custody. According to one of the victims, police forces used a taser, beat her up, and forced her to undress inside the station. The victim also reported assaults by other inmates after being placed in a male-only cell. There were no fatalities.

source: La Opinion (Colombia); Diario La Libertad; UNOCHA
notes: On 3 January 2022, in the rural area of Toledo municipality (Norte de Santander), a civilian woman was killed by unidentified armed individuals in El Porvenir de las Canoas vereda. There is presence of several armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

source: UNOCHA; Diario La Libertad; La Opinion (Colombia)
notes: On 3 January 2022, in the rural area of Toledo municipality (Norte de Santander), a man was killed an his body was found in La Margua vereda. Another man was injured in the same event. 1 fatality.
Around 3 January 2022 (as reported), in Riohacha (La Guajira), a Wayuu indigenous man was stabbed to death in the Mercado Nuevo sector. The motive is unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 3 January 2022 (as reported), in San Antonio (Valle del Cauca), three men were killed and their bodies were found with gunshot wounds and signs of torture. The Victims were Venezuelan nationals. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 3 fatalities.

On 3 January 2022, in Cartagena (Bolivar), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed two men in two different drive-by shooting incidents. The first incident occurred in the area of 'La Arrocera' Olaya Herrera, where the perpetrators shot and killed a man after mistaking the victim for another person. Subsequently, in a second attack, the perpetrators killed a softball player in the Alto Bosque neighborhood. The victim died in a hospital 7 days after the attack due to the severity of his injuries. Authorities stated that members of the Gulf Clan are responsible for the attack and that the events are part of the armed group's attempt to control illegal economies in the city. 2 fatalities.

Around 3 January 2022 (between 2 January - 5 January) in the rural area of Toledo municipality (Norte de Santander), members of an unidentified armed group killed 3 civilians and injured 2 people. There are no further details on the attack or potential perpetrators, but the incident triggered the forced displacement of 84 people residents of the El Porvenir and El Margua veredas (Gibraltar corregimiento). The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 3 fatalities.

On 3 January 2022, in Curumani (Cesar), an off-duty police officer was shot and killed by two unidentified armed men in a drive-by shooting in the San Jose neighborhood. The perpetrators fled. 1 fatality.

On 3 January 2022, in Llana Alta (Norte de Santander), a man was shot and wounded in the leg by a military officer when he was going to his house after armed clashes had taken place in the area (coded separately). The army had detained four people and then shot the man. There were no fatalities.

Around 3 January 2022 (as reported), in Santa Marta (Magdalena), a man was beaten, tortured and shot with a traumatic weapon by two police officers inside a police station, leaving him injured. The victim did not stop at a checkpoint, therefore, was chased by the officers and then taken to the station were he was attacked. There were no fatalities.

On 3 January 2022, in Puerto Berrio (Antioquia), a two brothers were shot and killed by two unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle in a drive-by shooting. The motive of the attack is unknown. 2 fatalities.
On 2 January 2022, in San Antonio (Valle del Cauca), a man was killed by unknown individuals near the local cemetery. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

On 2 January 2022, in the rural area of El Carmen de Bolivar (Bolivar), a woman social leader of the region, who is also a farmer, was killed in the Soltones de Meza sector. There is presence of the Gulf Clan in the area, which has been threatening the population and ordering who to vote for in the next elections. 1 fatality. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 2 January 2022, in the rural area of Arauquita municipality (Arauca), ELN forcibly recruited at least 20 young people. The armed men forced the victims to join the armed group under threat of death. The whereabouts of the victims are still unknown.
Around 1 January 2022 (weekend of), in Pescador (Cauca), two farmers were shot and killed by unidentified armed individuals when they were gathered at a public establishment. 2 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
notes: On 1 January 2022, in the rural area of Fortul municipality (Arauca), unidentified armed individuals abducted a former FARC member in the Cano Seco area. Two men on a motorcycle arrived where the victim was with a friend and forced him on the vehicle. Subsequently, perpetrators fled the area. The whereabouts of the victim are still unknown. The area is known for the presence of armed groups.

On 1 January 2022, in El Bagre (Antioquia), unidentified armed individuals killed a young Zenu indigenous person who was a member of the Noventa indigenous reserve area. There are no further details on the attack or potential perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 1 January 2022, in the rural area of Tame municipality (Arauca), ELN members abducted and killed a local farmer after accusing him of supporting a different armed group. Perpetrators abducted the victim from his private residence and hours later sent a message to the family telling them to pick up the body. 1 fatality.

Around 1 January 2022 (as reported), in the rural area of Buenaventura municipality (Valle del Cauca), a man was killed and his body was found in La Caucana vereda. The motive and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.
On 31 December 2021, in Tibu (Norte de Santander), a man was shot and killed by unidentified armed individuals in the Largo neighborhood. There is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

Around 31 December 2021 (as reported), in Puerto Santander municipality (Norte de Santander), a man was killed and his body was found in the Grita River. It has been claimed that the victim worked smuggling goods through the border with Venezuela. There is presence of armed groups in the municipality. 1 Fatality.

Around 31 December 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of Puerto Santander municipality (Norte de Santander), a woman was killed and her body was found with a gunshot wound in the head in El Dave vereda. The motive is unknown. There is presence of armed groups in the municipality. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); Women (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action
source: UNOCHA; El Pais (Colombia); El Tiempo (Colombia); Caracol Radio
notes: On 31 December 2021, in San Pedro municipality (Valle del Cauca), a woman social leader, who was also the secretary of a Council of Communal Action (JAC) was shot and killed by unidentified armed men outside her house and in front of her family. 1 fatality. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 31 December 2021, in Puerto Valdivia (Antioquia), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man, and wounded another, who were driving a motorcycle. The area is known for the presence of armed groups, which have threatened motorcycle drivers in the past with night curfews. 1 fatality.

On 30 December 2021, in the rural area of El Zulia municipality (Norte de Santander), a woman was shot four times and wounded by four unidentified armed individuals in a drive-by shooting in the Agua la Sal vereda. It has been known that the victim had to flee eight years ago because of threats and had returned to the municipality a few months ago. There were no fatalities.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: Around 30 December 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of San Jose del Guaviare municipality (Guaviare), two people were killed after the incursion of a group of members of a FARC Dissident faction. 2 fatalities.

On 30 December 2021, in Ricaurte (Magdalena), unidentified armed individuals broke into a cockfighting ring and shot dead three people, including a councilman. Two other people were injured in the attack. There are no further details on the possible perpetrators. 3 fatalities.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Oliver Sinisterra Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Oliver Sinisterra Front)
assoc_actor_2: Labour Group (Colombia); Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); Afro-Colombian Ethnic Group (Colombia)
notes: On 27 December 2021, in Barbacoas (Narino), members of the FARC Dissident group Oliver Sinisterra Front shot and killed a local musician who was also an Afro-Colombian social leader in the community. The perpetrators opened fire on the victim while he was in the main park of the city. 1 fatality.

Around 27 December 2021, in the rural area of Caldono municipality (Cauca), an indigenous person was killed and his body was found. The victim was tortured and subsequently shot dead. The community claimed the man was a member of the Indigenous reserve area of Las Delicias. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 26 December 2021, in the rural area of Sacama (Casanare), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed three members of the same family in the Sabanalarga vereda. Perpetrators broke into the victims' house and shot them dead. There are no further details on the motive for the attack or potential perpetrators, but there is the presence of ELN, FARC dissident factions and Gulf Clan members in the area. 3 fatalities.

Around 26 December 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of Las Tallas corregimiento (Cauca), a man was shot and killed and his body was found. The motive of the attack is unknow. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 25 December 2021, in the rural area of Puerto Leguizamo (Putumayo), unidentified armed individuals attacked a Witoto indigenous community in the Bellavista indigenous reserve area, killing seven people. The incident triggered the displacement of 120 other members of the community. Moreover, an indigenous organization claimed the whereabouts of several people remain unknown after the attack. 7 fatalities.

Around 24 December 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of La Gabarra corregimiento (Norte de Santander), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a youth in the La Serpentina vereda. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrator's motivation, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 24 December 2021 (as reported), in Ciudad Bolivar (Antioquia), a man was killed and his body was found in the Manzanillo neighborhood. There is no further information. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 24 December 2021 (as reported), the rural area the Yolombo town (Antioquia), a man was killed by unknown perpetrators in a farm. There is no further information. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 23 December 2021, in Maicao (La Guajira), unidentified armed individuals who arrived on a motorcycle broke into the house of a young Wayuu indigenous person in the La Armonia neighborhood and shot dead the victim. There are no further details on the attack or potential perpetrators, but authorities claimed it could be a case of clan disputes. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: JAC: Council of Communal Action; Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
notes: On 23 December 2021, in San Pablo (Bolivar), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a social leader who was also a member of the JAC. One of the perpetrators burst into the restaurant where the victim was eating, opened fire on him, and subsequently fled the area on a motorcycle driven by a second man. The victim was about to take office in the local council after the elected candidate resigned after being arrested on drug trafficking charges. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: JAC: Council of Communal Action; Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
notes: On 23 December 2021, in the rural area of Andes municipality (Antioquia), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a social leader in the El Perucho vereda. The victim was a member of the JAC. The assailants burst into the place where the community was holding a festive celebration and opened fire on the victim in front of the other attendees. The area is known for the presence of members of the Gulf Clan and the ELN. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Franco Benavides Mobile Column: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Franco Benavides Mobile Column)
source: El Universal (Colombia); El Pais (Colombia); El Tiempo (Colombia); El Colombiano
notes: On 23 December 2021, in the rural area of Esmeraldas corregimiento (Narino), unidentified armed individuals kidnapped an off-duty policeman. The victim was in a public service bus on the road that connects the town with the municipal capital when armed men stopped the vehicle and conducted an identity check on all passengers. After the victim identified himself as a member of the police, the perpetrators forced him out of the vehicle and fled the area with the victim. In a video released as a live-proof, the FARC dissident faction Franco Benavides claimed responsibility for the abduction. Around 27 December, the victim was released following the intervention from local farmers.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Mobile Column: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Teofilo Forero Castro)
notes: On 22 December 2021, in the rural area of San Vicente Del Caguan (Caqueta), three businessmen disappeared after traveling from Tolima to do business in the area. On 16 January 2022, the FARC dissident faction Teofilo Forero claimed they had abducted the men, including that one of the victims was killed during an escape attempt. The whereabouts of the other 2 victims remain unknown. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Dagoberto Ramos: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Dagoberto Ramos)
notes: Around 21 December 2021, in the rural area of Totoro municipality (Cauca), suspected members of the FARC dissident faction Dagoberto Ramos attacked a farmer while the community was holding a social activity at a community center. The armed group also distributed leaflets on the same days announcing that local businesses could only open until 11 pm. There are no further details about the attack.

Around 20 December 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of Tibu (Norte de Santander), a civilian was killed and his body was found in the el 88 vereda, from the Petrolera corregimiento. The victim came to the area from the city of Cucuta in search of work opportunities. The body was found with several gunshot wounds to the head. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Carlos Patino Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Carlos Patino Front)
notes: Around 20 December 2021, in the rural area of El Plateado (Cauca), suspected members of the Carlos Patino FARC dissident faction shot and killed a man. Near the body, perpetrators left a note announcing that the victim was killed for selling drugs in the area. 1 fatality.

source: Diario La Libertad; UNOCHA; El Tiempo (Colombia)
notes: Around 19 December 2021, in the rural area of San Jose de Apartado municipality (Antioquia), unidentified armed individuals raided the house of a local farmer who was also a social leader in his community in the La Balsa vereda, killing the victim. The man had reported a suspected case of corruption in the construction of a local road. 1 fatality.

Around 19 December 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of Corinto municipality (Cauca), military soldiers opened fire on a civilian's vehicle when the man ignored a stop sign from the officers. As a result of the gunfire, the driver lost control of his car and crashed. The driver died in the incident. 1 fatality.

Around 17 December 2021, in Unguia (Choco), unidentified armed individuals broke into the local hospital and shoot and killed a patient. The victim was being treated by medical staff when the perpetrators interrupted and killed him. The men subsequently fled the area. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
assoc_actor_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
notes: On 17 December 2021, in the rural area of La Macarena (Meta), suspected members of a FARC dissident faction attacked the vehicles in which several former FARC members were being evacuated from the area. The group had been forcibly displaced due to increasing death threats from armed groups. The armed men opened fire on the vehicles. Subsequently, two men on motorcycles approached one of the trucks and set it on fire. Some sources claimed three people are missing but this information is not yet confirmed. Casualties unknown.

Around 16 December 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of Guarumo corregimiento, Caceres (Antioquia), a merchant was kidnapped by unidentified individuals. The kidnappers had tricked the merchant to go from Rionegro to Guarumo with the purpose of making business but when the victim met them he was kidnapped. The victim was rescued later by military forces.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: Around 16 December 2021, in the rural area of Argelia municipality (Cauca), members of a FARC dissident faction killed a resident. There are no further details on the attack. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Mobile Column: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Adan Izquierdo)
notes: Around 15 December 2021, in the rural area of San Pedro municipality (Valle del Cauca), armed men who identified themselves as members of the Adan Izquierdo FARC dissident faction held hostage a group of musicians in the Matecito vereda. The victims were contacted by a person who hired their services. Police traced the call to a prison in Combita (Boyaca). When the victims arrived at the area, the armed perpetrators demanded money in exchange for their release. The victims were subsequently released by the perpetrators.

source: Diario La Libertad; El Tiempo (Colombia); UNOCHA
notes: On 15 December 2021, in San Luis (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and wounded an indigenous man when he resisted a kidnapping attempt in the town's main square. The perpetrators shot the victim in the back as he was running away from the gunmen. The victim was taken to a local hospital, but the perpetrators broke into the facility and killed the victim while medical personnel was treating his injuries. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident - 1st Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (1st Front - Armando Rios)
notes: On 15 December 2021, in the rural area of Mapiripan (Meta), suspected members of the FARC 1st dissident front abducted a group of 19 people, 17 of them members of a medical mission from an NGO. The team was in the Rincon del Indio area doing fieldwork when the armed men kidnapped them. Around 17 December, military forces reported the release of the victims, but there were no further details of the rescue operation.

Around 15 December 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of Palmira municipality (Valle del Cauca), a man was killed and his body was found with bullet wounds in the head in Los Dolores corregimiento. There is no information about the perpetrators or the motive of the attack but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

source: UNOCHA; INDEPAZ; El Tiempo (Colombia); El Espectador
notes: On 13 December 2021, in Bugalagrande (Valle del Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed three young men in the El Carmelo neighborhood in a shootout. The perpetrators broke into the house and opened fire on the victims, subsequently fleeing the area on a motorcycle. One version of the incident claimed that the perpetrators talked with one of the victims before opening fire, but this information was not confirmed. The area is known for the presence of the Gulf Clan, ELN, and the Adan Izquierdo FARC dissident faction. 3 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Indigenous Group (Colombia); Women (Colombia); Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
source: UNOCHA; El Tiempo (Colombia); Diario La Libertad
notes: On 13 December 2021, in the rural area of Caldono (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals opened fire on the vehicle that transported an indigenous leader and her family in the Los Quingos vereda. The car was assigned to the victim by the UNP due to death threats by armed groups in the area. The woman is also the sister of another leader indigenous leader killed in April due to her open opposition to coca crops inside indigenous reserve areas. There were no fatalities. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders] [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action
notes: Around 13 December 2021 (as reported), in Cartagena Del Chaira (Caqueta), a social leader who was a member of the sports committee of the local JAC was shot and killed. There are no further details on the attack or potential perpetrators. 1 fatality

Around 13 December 2021, in the rural area of El Tambo municipality (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals arrived at the house of a young farmer in the area, dragged him out of his residence, and shot him dead. Although the authorship of the attack has not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 13 December 2021, in the rural area of Puerto Gaitan (Meta), unidentified armed individuals opened fire on two private vehicles, killing one person. There are no further details on the attack or potential perpetrators, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 12 December 2021, in the rural area of Tibu municipality (Norte de Santander), two men were killed, and their bodies with gunshot wounds were found near the Filo El Gringo corregimiento. Near the bodies, two signs were left that said the victims were killed for being thieves and killers. Although the authorship of the attack has not been confirmed, the area is known for the presence of different FARC dissident factions and other armed groups. 2 fatalities.

actor1: FARC Dissident - 28th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (28th Front - Jose Maria Cordoba)
notes: Around 12 December 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of Hato Corozal (Casanare), suspected members of the FARC dissidence 28th faction abducted four workers who are part of the construction team that works in road repair projects in the area. Two of the workers were released hours later by the armed group, but the whereabouts of two more of the victims are still unknown.
