The group was chasing armed men who earlier had released prisoners detained in the city hall. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: On 5 March 2018, in Pioya Indigenous Reserve, in Caldono, armed men, FARC dissidents, deployed an armed operation to take three of their members back from the Nasa indigenous authorities. During the action the perpetrators shot their weapons and one indigenous guard was killed. Eight members of FARC that perpetrated the attack were captured by the indigenous guard and will be taken to trial. Their weapons will be destroyed. 1 Fatality.

On 3 March 2018, in La Gabarra, rural area of Tibu, a sexual worker woman was killed by an unknown individual. This action occurred in the context of threats against sexual workers by ELN and EPL armed groups. Analysts consider this attack as related to the armed conflict in the area.

On 3 March 2018, in Tibu, Norte De Santander, a woman owner of a bar was killed by an unknown individual. Another man resulted injured. This action occurred in the context of threats against sexual workers by ELN and EPL armed groups. Social organizations working in the area, consider that this attack is related to the armed conflict in the area. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action
source: ProtectDefenders.eu; UNOCHA; INDEPAZ; Front Line Defenders
notes: On 3 March 2018, in Orito, Putumayo, a community leader and JAC member was shot dead by two unidentified armed men, in front of the City Hall. Two more people were injured in the attack. 1 fatality.

On 2 March 2018, in Orito, Putumayo, the president of the Community Action Board of the Los Alpes neighborhood was killed. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators, circumstances of death, or crime motivation.

source: ProtectDefenders.eu; El Colombiano; UNOCHA; INDEPAZ; Front Line Defenders
notes: On 2 March 2018, in Caucasia municipality, Antioquia, an indigenous leader and farmer from the Zenu indigenous community of Tigre Dos was killed by unidentified armed men. In the action another indigenous man was injured. Days before the attack, there have been report on clashes between different armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: On 28 February 2018, in Filipinas, rural area of Arauquita, armed FARC dissidents attacked a member of the FARC political party. The injured man was taken to a Hospital outside the province.

assoc_actor_2: Indigenous Group (Colombia); Former Government of Colombia (2010-2018); Teachers (Colombia)
notes: Around 28 February 2018 (as reported), in the rural area of Buenaventura, an unidentified armed group kidnapped and tortured during 12 hours a teacher and former governor of an indigenous community.

On 28 February 2018, in Monos vereda, Antioquia, five men were killed by unidentified armed men. According to the report, relatives of two of the main leaders of Gulf Clan (AGC) are residents of this vereda. 5 fatalities.

Around 27 February 2018, in Mapiripan, Meta, a woman was killed and her body was found with signs of her arms having been tied up. The victim was a leader of the Jiw indigenous community and lived in the Mocuare reservation. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or crime motivation. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]
On 27 February 2018, in Gonzalez municipality, Cesar, a peasant was killed by two unidentified men who arrived at his home and shot him in Cerro Azul vereda. 1 fatality.

On 27 February 2018, in Ocana, Norte de Santander, armed men kidnapped a woman when she was leaving her working place and going home. Years ago one of her brothers was kidnapped by illegal armed groups and he was later rescued in a military operation. She was released 35 days later. Several armed groups operate in this department.

On 26 February 2018, in the rural area of Puerto Asis municipality, Putumayo department, a female public defender and Ombudsman's office director was killed and the perpetrator and its motivations are unknown.

On 26 February 2018, in Alto de Minas municipality, Antioquia, some of the advisers of the Municipality Office of La Pintada were attacked in a drive-by shooting by unidentified armed men on a motorcycle. Two public servants resulted injured and are receiving medical attention at Cladas' Hospital.

On 25 February 2018, in Bucaramanga, Santander, a JAC leader was stabbed to death by a man in El Cristal neighbourhood. The attacker stabbed the victim following a fight with a man who was suspected of stealing the victims's roosters.
On 25 February 2018, in Tibu, Norte de Santander, members of the National Liberation Army (ELN) attacked and killed three Venezuelan citizens. The motive of the attack is not reported. 3 fatalities.

February 24, 20189. In Mani, a paramilitary group attacked a woman's house, shooting at her dogs and killing them with automatic weapons, and destroying her crops. She is the president of ASOPROVICMA, a victim's organisation that is active in claiming for their lands. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 23 February 2018, in Cucuta, Norte De Santander, a man was killed in his apartment by two armed men. The victim was a member of the Cooperative of Credit COOMUTRANORT, in which he held a position in the supervisory committee. He was also the former treasurer of the Asojuntas of the commune 5 in Cucuta. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or crime motivation.
On 23 February 2018, in Tumaco, Narino, an unidentified armed suspect killed a man in a drive-by shooting. Several armed groups operate in this department. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Colombia); MP: Patriotic March; Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
source: UNOCHA; INDEPAZ; Front Line Defenders; RCN Radio; ProtectDefenders.eu
notes: On 23 February 2018, in Balboa municipality, Cauca, an unidentified armed man killed a human rights activist and member of Balboa Peasants Association ASCATBAL and Patriotic March Movement, in a drive-by shooting, in La Esperanza vereda. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); Government of Colombia (2010-2018)
notes: On 22 February 2018, in Tulua, Valle del Cauca, a social leader was shot by an unidentified man. He works for the department's Land Restitution Program. The perpetrator arrived to the house of the victim and shot him several times. The victim was not injured. The National Protection Unit reinforced the security measures for the victim.

source: El Tiempo (Colombia); UNOCHA; Diario del Sur (Colombia)
notes: On 22 February 2018, in La Guayacana corregimiento, Narino, hooded armed men stopped a bus and injured the bus driver. They forced the passengers and the worker to get off the bus and proceeded to set it on fire. The military forces arrived later to secure the area.

On 20 February 2018, in Petrolea municipality, Norte de Santander, a man was kidnapped by several armed men on motorcycles on the road that connects Petrolea and Campo Dos. Suspects identified themselves as members of ELN. He was released seven hours later.

Around 19 February 2018 (as reported), in Medellin - Southwest (Antioquia), a police officer on leave was killed and his body was found in the Altavista corregimiento with multiple gunshot wounds. Armed groups are present in the region and dispute control over the territory for drug trafficking, including Gulf Clan (AGC). 1 fatality.

On 19 February 2018, in Tumaco municipality, Narino, two men were shot and killed in different areas of the municipality. Both were killed with shots in the head. One was killed in a drive-by shooting in the Comuna 4 sector and the other in California sector. According to the report, score settling or crossing territorial boundaries of different armed groups are possible reasons for the crimes. There is no information on the perpetrators of the attack. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 2 fatalities.

On 18 February 2018, in Cajibio municipality, Cauca, an indigenous leader was shot and injured by unidentified suspects on the Panamericana road. According to the report, suspects were trying to rob his motorcycle. Relatives and friends asked the police to investigate if the attack was related to his social activities in the community.

On 18 February 2018, in Patio Bonito corregimiento, Cordoba, the manager of five cattle farms was shot dead by Gulf Clan (AGC) members. According to the report, in this area, armed groups had previously threatened to kill those who do not pay them extortions. 1 fatality.

On 18 February 2018, in Taraza municipality, Antioquia, two farmers were killed in the rural area. After these killings, several families were displaced in fear due to recent violent cases. There is no information on the perpetrators of the attack. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 2 fatalities.

On 18 February 2018, in Tumaco, Narino, a merchant was killed by unidentified armed men in Isla del Morro neighborhood. His death is linked to extortion operated by armed groups in the region. 1 fatality.

Around 17 February 2018 (as reported), in Olaya Herrera, Narino, a man was killed and his body was found with seven gunshot wounds. There is no information on the perpetrators of the attack. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 1 fatality.

Around 17 February 2018 (between 15 - 19 February), in Tumaco municipality, Narino, a social leader and rapper was killed and his body was found in El Tigre sector. The victim was kidnapped on 15 February by unidentified men when he was arriving at his house. 1 fatality.

source: Front Line Defenders; ProtectDefenders.eu; INDEPAZ; Caracol Radio; UNOCHA
notes: Around 17 February 2018 (as reported), in Filo Gringo vereda, Norte de Santander, a social leader and broadcaster of the community was killed and his body was found with gunshot wounds. Local organizations and leaders asked the authorities to clarify the death. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); PLC: Colombian Liberal Party; Former Government of Colombia (2010-2018)
source: ProtectDefenders.eu; Front Line Defenders; INDEPAZ; UNOCHA
notes: On 17 February 2018, in Quimbaya, Quindio, a community leader was killed. The victim was known for his work in supporting the community in cultural claims in the municipality. He was a former councilor of the Liberal Party from 2012 to 2016. The victim had intentions to launch himself as a mayor candidate in the upcoming elections. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators, circumstances of death, or crime motivation. 1 fatality.

Around 16 February 2018 (as reported), in Tumaco, Narino, a fisherman was killed and his body was found. Authorities believe his death may be related to score settling. There is no information on the perpetrators of the attack. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Colombia (2010-2018) Prison Guards
notes: On 16 February 2018, in Valledupar, Cesar, the director of a penitentiary, who was off-duty, was attacked with shots by two unidentified men in a drive-by shooting. He was in a car with two more people when he was attacked. The victim had received previous threats against his life, including a threat by the Gulf Clan. No fatalities or injuries occurred. Police investigates the authors of the crime.

On 16 February 2018, in Tibu municipality, Norte de Santander, a minor was killed in the rural area of the municipality. Information on motivation and perpetrators of the attack remains unknown. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 1 fatality.

On 15 February 2018, in Bogota, Bogota, D.C., two unidentified men shot and injured a Patriotic Union leader in a drive-by shooting in Alameda neighborhood. The man works in the human rights area of an agroecological association in Guamaco (Aheramigua), and reported paramilitary presence in Bajo Cauca and in the south of Bolivar. He was under special protection since 2016, when he was threatened and intimidated in the north of the country.

On 14 February 2018, in Belen de Bajira corregimiento, Choco, a social leader was kidnapped by Gulf Clan (AGC) members and taken to Chigorodo. He was rescued by the national army a day after the kidnapping.
On 14 February 2018, in La Guayacana corregimiento, Narino, a social leader was killed by unidentified armed men. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 1 fatality.
On 12 February 2018, in Quimbaya, Quindio, a dignitary of JAC board was killed. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators, circumstances of attack, or its motivation.

On 12 February 2018, in Cano Guarapo, rural area, a JAC Communal Action Council member was killed. He was part of of the Commission of Coexistence and Conciliation of the JAC, and was kidnapped by ELN militias a week before.

assoc_actor_2: JAC: Council of Communal Action; Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
notes: On 12 February 2018, in Cano Guarapo vereda, Arauca, a man was shot multiple times and killed by members of the ELN. He was a member of the Council of Communal Action of Corocito. The victim was kidnapped on February 5th by the ELN who accused him of sexually assaulting a girl. 1 fatality.

On 11 February 2018, Tumaco, Narino, a 17-year-old man was killed in El Morrito neighbourhood. Social organizations report that this event is related to the presence of armed groups in Tumaco that had a previous clash in the dock area. 1 fatality.

Around 11 February 2018 (as reported), in Llorente corregimiento, Narino, a farmer was killed and his body was found. Police has not confirmed yet if the body had any signs of torture. According to the report, a friend of the victim is reported as missing. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 1 fatality.

On 11 February 2018, in Puerto Claver corregimiento, Antioquia, Gulf Clan (AGC) members killed an ex combatant of FARC. This party reported what they call ''a campaign of extermination'' against former members of FARC, seeking to undermine the peace agreements. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: MP: Patriotic March; JAC: Council of Communal Action; Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
source: UNOCHA; Front Line Defenders; INDEPAZ; UMAIC; ProtectDefenders.eu
notes: On 11 February 2018, in El Tarra municipality, Norte de Santander, a leader of the Patriotic March Movement was killed in El Tarra Sur vereda. He was also a member of the Council of Communal Action JAC. There is no information on the perpetrators of the attack. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 1 fatality.

On 10 February 2018, in Caucasia, Antioquia, and unidentified group killed one person and injured other four in Olimpico Stadium neighborhood. There is no information on the perpetrators of the attack. There is presence of several armed groups in this department. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: MP: Patriotic March; Farmers (Colombia); Afro-Colombian Ethnic Group (Colombia)
source: INDEPAZ; ProtectDefenders.eu; UNOCHA; RCN Radio; Front Line Defenders
notes: On 9 February 2018, in Guapi, Cauca, two afro-Colombian leaders of the illicit crops substitution process were killed by several hooded men. The victims were also part of the Patriotic March Movement and the Ethnic and Popular Movement of the Pacific. The authorities are investigating if the ELN was the perpetrators of the attack. 2 fatalities.

On 9 February 2018, in Sirimunda vereda, Valle del Cauca, four members of the ELN kidnapped a farmer. He managed to escape and waited until police forces rescued him. 12 years ago he was kidnapped with his brother and remained two years in ELN's hands.

On 8 February 2018, in Taraza municipality, Antioquia, a social leader, working in crop substitution programs, was killed inside his house in El Doce corregimiento, La Pipiola vereda. Authorities believe that Gulf Clan (AGC) members may be the perpetrators of the crime. 1 fatality.

On 8 February 2018, in La Gabarra corregimiento, Norte de Santander, a man was killed by unidentified men. According to the report, the killing seems to be part of a social cleansing. The perpetrators arrived to the victim's house asking for him, and as soon as he appeared they killed him and put a sign over him saying ''We killed him for dealing drugs. The cleaning continues.'. Police investigates the perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident - 1st Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (1st Front - Armando Rios)
notes: Around 7 February 2018 (month of), in San Vicente Del Caguan municipality, Caqueta, a minor was forcibly recruited by FARC dissident 1st Front. During an army operation, officers released him and send him to the regional social care assistance.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: On 6 February 2018, in Puerto Concordia, Meta, an indigenous leader was beaten to death by suspected FARC dissidents in El Palmar area. The victim was also the sheriff of the Cano La Sal Indigenous Reservation of the Jiw Indigenous Town.

assoc_actor_2: Women (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action; Tibu Communal Group (Colombia)
source: Front Line Defenders; ProtectDefenders.eu; UNOCHA; INDEPAZ

Her body was found with gunshot wounds in La Primavera vereda. She was reported as disappeared on 27 September 2017. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. There is no information on the perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

assoc_actor_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
notes: On 6 February 2018, in Montecristo municipality, Bolivar, a former FARC member was killed in Puerto Guamo vereda. According to representatives of the FARC party, the ELN was the responsible for the attack. 1 fatality.

On 5 February 2018, in Corocito, rural area of Tame, JAC: Communal Action Council member Omar Arbey Martinez was kidnapped by ELN militias. He is part of the Commission of Coexistence and Conciliation of the JAC.
On 5 February 2018, in Bogota-Usme, Bogota, D.C, a man was shot and killed by an member of an armed group. The man was known for his communal work.

On 5 February 2018, in Guayacana vereda, Narino, a farmer was killed by an unidentified armed man. According to the report, the killing was related to extortion by an unidentified armed group. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 1 fatality.

On 4 February 2018, in La Gabarra corregimiento, Norte de Santander, a man was killed by unidentified armed men. According to the report, the killing seems to be part of a social cleansing. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 1 fatality.

On 4 February 2018, in Tumaco municipality, Narino, a member of an indigenous community was killed in Inda Guaracay reserve. There is no information on the perpetrator. Community members warn for the threats to their life in the region and also reported the forced recruitment by armed groups that is happening in other reservations. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 1 fatality.

On 3 February 2018, in Ciudad Bolivar, Bogota, an unidentified armed man shot dead a woman teacher. The victim was known for her work with the community. Another woman who was with her was also injured.

source: Front Line Defenders; ProtectDefenders.eu; INDEPAZ; UNOCHA; Somos Defensores
notes: On 1 February 2018, in Pueblo Rico, Risaralda, a female social leader who advocated for the protection of natural resources, was killed by hooded men. She had reported illegal mining activities in Santa Cecilia, Pueblo Rico. 1 fatality. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 1 February 2018, in Samaniego, Narino, two communal leaders were killed by two unidentified armed men. According to the report, the attack might be related to the arrival of FARC dissidents in the territory. 2 fatalities.

On 31 January 2018, in Cucuta, Norte De Santander, two men were attacked by two unidentified individuals. The inhabitants of region's rural zone reported threats by 20 armed men, being impeded to work and to circulate. There is presence of post-demobilization armed groups in the department.
On 31 January 2018, in Puerchag, rural area of Samaniego, a 23 year old man was killed. The death is related to the presence of armed actors in the area. 16 bullets impacted the body of the victim.

assoc_actor_2: JAC: Council of Communal Action; Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
source: INDEPAZ; Front Line Defenders; ProtectDefenders.eu; Panorama del San Jorge; UNOCHA
notes: On 31 January 2018, in San Jose de Ure municipality, Cordoba, armed men killed the treasurer of the Council of Communal Action JAC in Batalito corregimiento. He worked for the JAC of Nueva Ilusion. The perpetrators arrived to their victim's house, forced him to go out and shot him. There is no information on the perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality.

On 31 January 2018, in Los Pondores vereda, La Guajira, a retired military officer was shot and killed by an unidentified armed man. The author escaped on a motorcycle. There is no information on the perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality.

Around 31 January 2018 (as reported), in Puerchag vereda, Narino, a man was killed and his body was found near a soccer camp. His killing is related to the presence of armed groups operating in the department. There is no information on the perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality.

On 30 January 2018, on the road between Puerto Leon and Banco de Arena, Cucuta, two workers were killed by two unidentified men. The perpetrators shot them while the workers were on a motorcycle, and then proceeded to kill them off. Inhabitants of the area were threatened by 20 armed men, who said nobody can be out of their houses after 10 p.m. The unidentified armed men are also preventing some people to work in the area. Some mothers in Banco de Arena took their children off the school, as the neighbouring Police Station is threatened of an attack.

On 30 January 2018, in Ocana municipality, Norte de Santander, on the road that connects the municipality to Pueblo Novo corregimiento, a man and woman were shot and killed in a drive-by shooting by suspects on a motorcycle. Motive and authorship are unknown. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 2 fatalities.

On 30 January 2018, in Convencion, Norte De Santander, a helicopter of the Colombian Petrol Company ECOPETROL was shot when flying above Cerro Chapinero. The bullets hit the door of the helicopter. Company officials have encountered several violent actions on the oil infrastructure, perpetrated by ELN. The report does not mention the identity of the perpetrators. No fatalities occurred.

Around 30 January 2018 (as reported), in the rural area of San Calixto municipality, Norte de Santander, a female social and health worker of the municipality, was killed by armed men while entering her home. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 1 fatality.

On 29 January 2018, in Villavicencio municipality, Meta, a man shot against a group of people in Canos Negros sector. His target was the leader of a displaced people association, who was not in the place by the time of the event. Three people were killed, two others were injured. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 3 fatalities.

On 29 January 2018, in Feliciano vereda, Arauca, two men on a motorcycle arrived at a farm and killed a farmer after asking for three people who were not at the farm. The perpetrators are members of ELN. 1 fatality.

source: UNOCHA; INDEPAZ; Prensa Rural (Colombia); ProtectDefenders.eu; Front Line Defenders
notes: On 29 January 2018, in Cantagallo municipality, Bolivar, social leader and Council of Communal Action member was killed by unidentified men in Chaparral vereda. The victim was known as a defender of the rights of the peasants and for being a municipal mediator for the agreements to substitute illicit crops. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 1 fatality.

Around 28 January 2018 (as reported), in Cucuta, Norte De Santander, a man was killed and his body was found in Nueva Ilusion invasion. Motive and authorship are unknown. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 1 fatality.

Around 28 January 2018 (as reported), in Villa Del Rosario municipality, Norte de Santander, two men and a woman were killed and their bodies were found in El Palmar vereda. Police investigates motive and authorship on the cases. There is presence of several armed groups in the area.3 fatalities.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: On 28 January 2018, in Cabuyare vereda, Arauca, FARC dissident members killed two civilians who were at a farm with their wives. One of them worked for Arauca's Energy Company. 2 fatalities.

On 28 January 2018, in La Guayacana, Tumaco, unidentified armed men killed a civilian. According to the authorities, the attack is part of a ''social cleansing'' operation, as the victim was investigated in a robbery case. There is presence of several armed groups in this department. 1 fatality.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: Around 28 January 2018 (month of), in Puerto Leguizamo municipality, Putumayo department, two underaged were forcibly recruited by FARC dissidents. The victims were rescued by the military forces on April 2018.

On 27 January 2018, in Maicao, La Guajira, the former mayor of the city was attacked in a drive-by shooting by two men on a motorcycle in Altos des Boscan neighborhood. The victim was injured in different parts of the body. Authorities investigate the motivation and authorship of the crime.

source: UNOCHA; ProtectDefenders.eu; UMAIC; INDEPAZ; Front Line Defenders
notes: On 27 January 2018, in Buenaventura, Valle del Cauca, a social leader was killed in a drive-by shooting by two unidentified men who shot him from a motorcycle. The victim was a human rights activist. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 1 fatality.

On 26 January 2018, in La Holanda, rural area of Tame, a man was killed by an ELN member. The body was found with a note saying that the reason of the killing was that he was selling and taking drugs, and warning the population of what can happen to those who do the same.

On 3 January 2018, in rural zone of La Italia, San Jose del Palmar, a minor women was killed. Due to the obstacles to transport, the body arrived in La Italia urban zone one day later. Although the perpetrators are unknown the newspaper points out that the ELN operates in the zone. [women targeted: girls]

On 26 January 2018, in Tenche, rural area of San Jacinto, Bolivar, unidentified armed men burned the house of the father of the mayor. The family was inside the house and had to be helped to go out alive. The mayor of San Jacinto blamed political opponents for the action. No fatalities occurred.

On 26 January 2018, in Monterralo, Casanare, a contractor of the Colombian Petrol Company ECOPETROL was attacked by an armed man, a member of ELN, which operates in the region. The contractor is seriously injured.

source: UNOCHA; INDEPAZ; Panorama del San Jorge
notes: On 26 January 2018, around Monteria municipality, Cordoba, two men on a motorcycle shot and killed the former Mayor of Puerto Libertador. The motivation of the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. The victim was accused of having links with criminal organizations during his term in office. 1 fatality.

On 26 January 2018, in Tumaco, Narino, a man was shot and killed by an unidentified man while arriving at his house in Brisas del Aeropuerto neighborhood. Social organizations claim the killing is related to the presence and extorsion of armed groups in the region. There is no information on the perpetrators of the attack. There is presence of several armed groups in this department. 1 fatality.

On 26 January 2018, in San Rafael vereda, Valle del Cauca, a man who is the owner of a recognized supermarket chain, was kidnapped by unidentified members who invaded his property. He was taken to the border with the department with Huila. First, the criminals claimed they were ELN members and after they were FARC Dissidents. He managed to escape four days later with the help of a farmer. They wanted five billion pesos for his rescue.

Around 25 January 2018 (as reported), in Cucuta, Norte de Santander, a man was killed and his body was found with hands tied and gagged mouth in El Escobal sector. No further specifications. There is presence of armed groups in this department. 1 fatality.

notes: On 23 January 2018, in the rural area of Sucumbios, Narino, a peasant and social leader of the afro Colombian community Nueva Esperanza was killed. There is no information on the perpetrators. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); Afro-Colombian Ethnic Group (Colombia); MP: Patriotic March
notes: On 22 January 2018, in Ipiales, Narino, an MP (Patriotic March) member and community leader was killed. He was the leader of the Afro Nueva Esperanca community council. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or circumstances of his death.

On 22 January 2018, in Bagado, Choco, ELN members started a shoot-out against the indigenous community Cevede indigenous reserve, confining people and impeding their mobility. No fatalities or injuries occurred.

Around 22 January 2018, in La Cuatro, Tibu, Norte de Santander, four people were killed and their bodies found with signs of torture and gunshot wounds. According to the Police, the perpetrators are members of illegal armed groups that operate in the area. 4 fatalities

Around 22 January 2018 (as reported), near San Jose Del Palmar, Choco, a teenager was killed and his body was found with multiple shots in La Italia corregimiento. There is presence of several armed groups in this department. 1 fatality.

On 22 January 2018, in Tibu, Norte de Santander, four men were killed and their bodies were found with torture signs and multiple gunshot wounds. Authorities believe that armed groups that operate on the border between Venezuela and Colombia are involved in the attack. 4 fatalities.

source: UNOCHA; Front Line Defenders; ProtectDefenders.eu; La Voz del Cinaruco
notes: On 22 January 2018, In Saravena, Arauca, a leader of the Peasants Association ASONALCA, was killed in a drive-by shooting by men who shot him from a motorcycle. According to the police, the ELN is the perpetrator of this attack. 1 fatality.

source: Justice for Colombia; UNOCHA; La Opinion (Colombia)
notes: On 22 January 2018, in Cucuta municipality, Norte de Santander, a man was killed while driving between the cities of Cucuta and Tibu. The circumstances of the attack are unknown. According to the USO trade union, the victim worked in a petrol company and had been fired. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 1 fatality.

On 22 January 2018, in El Tarra municipality, Norte de Santander, unidentified armed men attacked the leader of the Catatumbo's Peasant Association, who was with his family in his house in San Isidro vereda. The victim survived the attack. No fatalities occurred.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
assoc_actor_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia; Government of Colombia (2010-2018)
notes: On 21 January 2018, in El Oasis, rural area of Arauquita, a commission of demobilised members of FARC that were working in substitution of illicit crops, was attacked by FARC dissidents. No members of the commission were injured, but another person, a Colombian Petrol Company ECOPETROL contractor, who was in a car close to the commission was killed. The dissidents of FARC seemed to have taken him for a member of the commission.

On 21 January 2018, in Bogota - Ciudad Bolivar (Bogota, D.C.) a former FARC militant was physically assaulted by two unidentified men and one woman. The perpetrators were armed but did not shoot the victim. They showed the victim photographs of some FARC members and threatened to kill them. Series of attacks were registered against FARC political party members.

On 21 January 2018, in La Estrella vereda, Antioquia, seven men were killed by a group of five men who had an assault rifle and two mini-Uzi. One of the perpetrators was wearing military clothes. There is presence of several armed groups in this department. 7 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Labour Group (Colombia); Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia; FARC: Common Alternative Revolutionary Force
source: La Voz del Cinaruco; UNOCHA; Justice for Colombia
notes: On 21 January 2018, in the rural area of Arauquita municipality, Arauca, a contractor who worked for the oil company ECOPETROL was killed while accompanying former members of FARC who were representing the FARC political party in a visit to verify the crop substitution programs. It is believed that the targets were two FARC members who survived. ELN militants were held responsible for the crime. 1 fatality.

Around 21 January 2018 (as reported), in Novita municipality, Choco, a man was killed and his body was found in Curundo corregimiento. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. There is no information on the perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality.

On 20 January 2018, in the rural area of Convencion municipality, Norte de Santander, two Venezuelan indigenous people of Bari ethnic group were shot and injured around vereda Cano Azul. They lived in the Kokshi community in Venezuela and were taken to the hospital in Maracaibo, Venezuelan side of the border. There is no information on the perpetrators. There is presence of several armed groups in the department.

On 20 January 2018, in Santander de Quilichao, Norte de Santander, two men were shot dead and one was injured in a drive-by shooting perpetrated by individuals on two motorcycles. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 2 fatalities.
On 20 January 2018, in Saravena, Arauca, members of ELN broke into a man's house, shot, and killed him. There is presence of several armed groups in the department. 1 fatality.

On 20 January 2018, in Caloto, Cauca, the nephew of the counsellor of ACIN (Association of Indigenous Councils of North Cauca) was killed in a drive-by shooting by men on a motorcycle. The community had recently reported the killings of vulnerable groups in the area. Authorities investigate if it is linked to a possible 'social cleansing'. There is presence of several armed groups in this department. 1 fatality.
On 20 January 2018, in Puerto Contreras, Arauca, an 18-year-old woman was killed. Police suspect that the perpetrators were members of the ELN. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Teachers (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action; Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
source: UNOCHA; AFP; Blu Radio; ProtectDefenders.eu; Front Line Defenders; La Voz
notes: On 20 January 2018, in Caceres, Antioquia, a teacher and social leader, member of the JAC, was killed and his body was found in the river Cauca, on 28 January. The victim was reported as disappeared. The cause of death is not reported. Massive displacements and death threats have been reported in the zone, due to the presence of the Gulf Clan. 1 fatality.
On 20 January 2018, in Arauquita, Arauca, a man was shot dead by members of the ELN. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: JAC: Council of Communal Action; Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
source: UNOCHA; ProtectDefenders.eu; Front Line Defenders; INDEPAZ; Prensa Rural (Colombia)
notes: On 19 January 2018, in Yondo, Antioquia, a local leader who was also the president of Council of Communal Action (JAC) of corregimiento El Tigre was shot and killed by unidentified armed men. There is presence of several armed groups in this department. 1 fatality.

Around 19 January 2018 (as reported), in La Esperanza vereda, Caqueta, three farmers were killed and their bodies were found after having been reported as disappeared. The men had arrived in the region to buy cattle. 3 fatalities.

On 19 January 2018, in San Rafael corregimiento, Valle del Cauca, a teacher was the target of an armed attack perpetrated by unidentified men after revealing that she is transgender and that she planned to change her sex. There is no information on the perpetrators of the attack. The victim survived the attack. According to the report, victim had openly opposed the presence of the AUC that operate in the area.

source: UNOCHA; La Voz del Cinaruco; INDEPAZ
notes: On 19 January 2018, in Tame, Arauca, a female teacher was killed by military forces as she was driving on a motorcycle. According to residents, the military forces classified the case as a clash between them and a ELN member who refused to obey a military roadblock. 1 fatality.

Around 19 January 2018 (as reported), in Villa Del Rosario, Norte De Santander, four people were killed and their bodies were found with hands and feet tied in La Parada neighborhood. One of the bodies was inside a garbage can. There is presence of several armed groups in this department. 4 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: JAC: Council of Communal Action; Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
source: Front Line Defenders; El Heraldo (Colombia); ProtectDefenders.eu
notes: On 18 January 2018, in San Jose de Ure municipality, a social leader and member of the JAC of the area of San Pedro was killed.

source: ProtectDefenders.eu; La Paz en el Terreno
notes: On 18 January 2018, in the rural area of Tame municipality, Arauca, a man and his brother were shot and killed by military forces. The man was a social movement leader and had been shot in unclear situations by the military, claiming that they had stopped both civilians from extorting other people. However, human rights organizations claimed that they were killed on purpose. 2 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action
source: Front Line Defenders; UNOCHA; Contagio Radio; INDEPAZ; ProtectDefenders.eu
notes: On 18 January 2018, in Cucuta, Norte de Santander, a social leader and president of the community council, was killed by a masked man who shot him several times. According to social organizations of the area this is the fourth case of murdering social leaders in the first weeks of 2018. One man linked to the killing was detained. 1 fatality.

Around 18 January 2018 (as reported), in La Italia corregimiento, Choco, members of the ELN killed a man and his body was found in Curundo corregimiento. The night before, ELN gathered community members to inform that the man was a robber. 1 fatality.

On 17 January 2018, in Zaragoza area, Antioquia, the daughter of an indigenous governor of the La Esperanza community was killed by a gang while travelling to Zaragoza. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 17 January 2018, in Tumaco, Narino, a fisherman was killed in a drive-by shooting by two unidentified individuals on motorcycle. The victim, 24-year-old, lived in El Pindo, neighbourhood where a dispute between armed groups is taking place. 1 fatality.

On 17 January 2018, in Chigorodo, Antioquia, an off-duty policeman was killed when he was boarding a bus. A man shot him in the back several times. He was with his wife, who was not injured. The police is investigating but the first indications suggest that the responsible are AGC (Gulf Clan) members.

On 17 January 2018, in Saravena, Arauca, a man was killed with multiple shots in the town center of Puerto Contreras. According to the report, the ELN had perpetrated similar killings days before this attack. 1 fatality.

Around 17 January 2018 (week of), around Monteria, in the south zone of Cordoba, six people were killed and their bodies were found carbonized. According to the report, the killings are related to disputes between armed groups over the control of coca crops. 6 fatalities.

source: Kapital Stereo; UNOCHA; La Voz del Cinaruco
notes: On 16 January 2018, in Fortul municipality, Arauca, locals reported the killing of a man on the road that leads to La Esmeralda town. Perpetrator is an ELN member. 1 fatality.

Around 16 January 2018 (week of), around Villa Del Rosario, Norte De Santander, three killings took place and the bodies were found blindfolded. Police believes the perpetrator(s) are the same, due to the modus operandi. One of the bodies was on the Venezuelan side of the border. There is presence of several armed groups in this department. 3 fatalities.
On 16 January 2018, in Cantagallo municipality, Bolivar, a farmer was attacked and killed by unidentified men in Santo Domingo vereda. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
notes: On 16 January 2018, in Peque, Antioquia, two ex-combatants of FARC, who were doing political campaign were killed by AGC (Gulf Clan) members. A police elite group is conducting the investigation. 2 fatalities.

On 16 January 2018, in the rural area of Zaragoza municipality, Antioquia, unidentified armed men killed the daughter of an indigenous chief who was visiting her mother in the area of La Concha. The Indigenous Organization of Antioquia (OIA) suspects the attack was perpetrated by armed groups that are disputing the control of the territory. OIA ask for respect of life of all civilians. 1 fatality. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 13 January 2018, in Tumaco, Narino, a teenager was killed by unknown armed people in El Pindo neighborhood. His death was related to a retaliation of an armed group operating in the region. 1 fatality.

On 13 January 2018, in Badillo, Santander, a farmer reported the kidnapping of four of his workers by armed men. He presumes the event is related to a land lawsuit. The Police and other civil authorities have not confirmed the kidnapping yet.

source: Telam; UNOCHA; La Voz del Cinaruco
notes: On 13 January 2018, in Saravena, Arauca, two armed men who said they were members of the Domingo Lain Sanz front of ELN, kidnapped a contractor of ISMOCOL (Colombian Oil Company). The contractor was taken from his office in Saravena. The engineer was released in December of that year, 11 months after his kidnapping.

On 11 January 2018, in Aguazul municipality, Casanare, a contractor of ECOPETROL, the Colombian petrol company, was killed in Plan Brisas sector. There is no information on the perpetrators. This attack follows an attack on the pipeline perpetrated by ELN the day before. The company asks the authorities to investigate and capture the perpetrators. 1 fatality.
On 10 January 2018, in Choco, the ELN perpetrated an attack against civilians and occupied territory. The actions began after the end of the ceasefire between the government and the rebel group.

On 10 January 2018, in Aguazul municipality, Casanare, a contractor of the Colombian Petrol Company ECOPETROL was killed in El Triunfo vereda. There is no information on the perpetrator of the attack. There is presence of members of the ELN in the area. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Former AUC: United Self-Defence Forces of Colombia
notes: On 10 January 2018, in San Pedro, Valle del Cauca, a former member of United Self-Defence Forces of Colombia (AUC) was attacked with shots and injured by an unidentified armed man. Police detained an individual, possibly related to the crime, but he was later released. There is presence of several armed groups in the area.
On 9 January 2018, in Saravena, Arauca, one man was killed when he and other man refused to attend a requirement by the police and ran away. The policeman reacted and shot the man who died.

On 9 January 2018, in El Diviso sector, Las Mercedes, Convencion, peasants found the dead body of a farmer with several bullet injuries in his head. The motivation and the perpetrators identities are unknown. There is presence of armed groups in the area.

Around 8 January 2018 (as reported), in Convencion municipality, Norte de Santander, a man was killed and his body was found with multiple gunshot wounds in the head by farmers in El Diviso area. There is presence of several armed groups in this department. 1 fatality.

On 7 January 2018, in Tumaco, Narino, a teenager was killed in Playa Recha sector. There is no information on the perpetrator of the attack. Local inhabitants told that they have warned the victim about the intention of other people to harm him. According to the report, the killing was linked to territorial dispute between armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

source: UNOCHA; ProtectDefenders.eu; Front Line Defenders; La W
notes: On 6 January 2018, in La Pena vereda, Cauca, an indigenous healer was killed with a knife by unidentified armed men. After 6 days in coma, the victim passed away at the hospital. Indigenous authorities asked for justice. There is no information on the perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: JAC: Council of Communal Action; Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
notes: On 5 January 2018, in Cienaga de Oro, Cordoba, a social leader disappeared. He was the former JAC president of El Higal, and currently JAC delegate of the area. His motorcycle was found the next day.

On 3 January 2018, in Campoalegre, Huila, the former mayor of Campoalegre suffered an attack while going to her house. The car she was in was shot twice in the rear in Independencia neighborhood. There is no information on the perpetrators of the attack. No injuries or fatalities occurred.

On 3 January 2018, in the rural zone of La Italia, San Jose del Palmar, a minor women was killed. Due to the obstacles to transport, the body arrived in La Italia urban zone one day later. Although the perpetrators are unknown the newspaper points out that the ELN operates in the zone. [women targeted: girls]

Around 3 January 2018 (week of), in Puerto Libertador, Cordoba, three female minors were forced to join a prostitution network, by Gulf Clan members. They were rescued by state forces later. [women targeted: girls]

On 3 January 2018, around San Jose Del Palmar, Choco, a teenager was killed nearby the corregimiento La Italia. There is presence of several armed groups in this department, specially ELN. 1 fatality.
Around 3 January 2018 (week of), three persons were killed in an attack by Gente del Orden in Tumaco.

actor1: GUP: United Guerrillas of the Pacific
notes: Around 3 January 2018 (week of), in Tumaco, Narino, GUP militants killed 5 civilians in Tumaco in an operation. 5 fatalities.

On 3 January 2018, in Tumaco, Narino, one man and a woman were killed by hitmen in a drive-by shooting while they were chatting in the street, in La Playa Avenue. The killings are associated to territorial disputes between armed groups in Tumaco. The article does not specify which armed groups are disputing territory. 2 fatalities.

Around 3 January 2018 (month of), in Tumaco, Narino, a man was killed and his body was found in El Tigre sector. Due to the state of the composition of the body, the cause of the death and the victim's identity were not identified. According to social and community leaders, the death was related to territorial dispute between armed groups. 1 fatality.

On 2 January 2018, Tumaco, Narino, a disabled man was killed by an unknown armed group that had threatened the community with doing a 'social cleansing'. The area is known for the presence of several armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 2 January 2018 (as reported), in Valledupar, Cesar, the municipal registrar of La Jagua de Ibirico was killed and his body was found in his house of Valledupar, with signs of torture and hands tied. The neighbours testified having seen him enter the house with two men that, after some time, went out alone. There is presence of several armed groups in this department. 1 fatality.

On 1 January 2018, in Tumaco, Narino, a 56 year old man was killed and a woman was injured after being attacked by an unknown armed group. The attack has been related to the victim's refusal to pay an extortion fee from armed groups present in the area. 1 fatality
